summaryText: Wow, what a powerful sermon about Revival by Pastor Travis Hearn! PT delivered an incredible message about how Revival begins - not with grand gestures, but with four simple yet transformative steps: humility, prayer, seeking God's face, and turning from wickedness. Can you imagine what could happen if we truly embraced these principles? Pastor Travis shared amazing stories about Impact Church's ongoing Revival - from 100 baptisms monthly to a Bible study that started with the Arizona Cardinals and now reaches thousands! The most incredible part? Revival always starts with ONE person saying 'yes' to God. PT emphasized that we don't need political movements, but biblical movements centered on Jesus Christ. The world might be in moral darkness, but God is still moving powerfully! The sermon was a passionate call to step out of our comfort zones, seek God's presence intimately, and allow Him to transform not just our individual lives, but our entire nation. PT's message wasn't just about Revival - it was about personal transformation and allowing God to use us mightily right where we are.
mainPoints: Prayer is essential for spiritual awakening
True Revival requires turning from wickedness

versesMentioned.text: If my people, who are called by my name, will humble themselves and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven, and I will forgive their sin and will heal their land.

Jabez cried out to the God of Israel, 'Oh, that you would bless me and enlarge my territory! Let your hand be with me, and keep me from harm so that I will be free from pain.' And God granted his request.
You will seek me and find me when you seek me with all your heart.
Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.

Yet I hold this against you: You have forsaken the love you had at first. Consider how far you have fallen! Repent and do the things you did at first. If you do not repent, I will come to you and remove your lampstand from its place.
Peter replied, 'Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.'
If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.

Monday.scripture: Isaiah 64:1: 'Oh, that you would rend the heavens and come down, that the mountains would tremble before you!'
Monday.focus: Cultivating a heart desperate for God's presence
Monday.action: Spend the first 15 minutes of your day in focused prayer, asking God to bring revival to your personal life. Write down areas where you need God's transformative power.
Monday.prayer: Lord, break my heart for what breaks Yours. Ignite a fire of revival in my soul and make me willing to be used by You. Show me where I need to humble myself before You. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Psalm 85:6: 'Will you not revive us again, that your people may rejoice in you?'
Tuesday.focus: Recognizing the need for personal spiritual renewal
Tuesday.action: Identify one area of spiritual complacency in your life. Create a specific plan to recommit to spiritual growth in that area.
Tuesday.prayer: God, reveal the areas of my life where I've grown lukewarm. Reignite my passion for You and help me turn away from anything that doesn't honor Your name. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: 2 Chronicles 7:14: 'If my people, who are called by my name, will humble themselves and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven, and I will forgive their sin and will heal their land.'
Wednesday.focus: Understanding the power of corporate prayer and repentance
Wednesday.action: Gather with at least one other believer to pray specifically for revival in your community, church, and nation.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, we come together seeking Your face. Forgive us for our individual and collective sins. Bring revival to our land, starting with us. Use us as instruments of Your transformative power. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Ephesians 4:22-24: 'You were taught, with regard to your former way of life, to put off your old self, which is being corrupted by its deceitful desires; to be made new in the attitude of your minds; and to put on the new self, created to be like God in true righteousness and holiness.'
Thursday.action: Make a list of old habits or thought patterns that don't align with God's vision for your life. Commit to replacing one of these with a godly alternative.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me recognize the areas where I need transformation. Give me the strength to put off my old self and embrace the new life You've called me to. Renew my mind and heart. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Romans 12:2: 'Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God's will is—his good, pleasing and perfect will.'
Friday.focus: Resisting worldly influences and seeking God's perspective
Friday.action: Audit your media consumption. Remove or limit content that doesn't align with godly values. Replace it with worship music, podcasts, or biblical teaching.
Friday.prayer: Father, help me guard my mind and heart. Show me where I've allowed worldly influences to shape my thinking. Renew my mind and align my thoughts with Your truth. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Acts 1:8: 'But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.'
Saturday.focus: Being prepared and available for God's use
Saturday.action: Reflect on your unique gifts and opportunities. Identify one practical way you can share your faith or serve others this week.
Saturday.prayer: Holy Spirit, fill me with Your power and boldness. Make me sensitive to Your leading and courageous in sharing Your love. Use me to bring revival wherever You send me. Amen.
